data.title: Rupaul Biography

data.text:
QUICK FACTS

Activities Actor , Designer , Screenwriter more

Real name RuPaul Andre Charles

Nationality USA

Born November 17, 1960 (San Diego, California)

BIOGRAPHY

Born and raised in San Diego, California, RuPaul moved to Atlanta to study performing arts. He settled in New York City, where he became a popular fixture on the nightclub scene. RuPaul achieved international fame with the release of the single “Supermodel (You Better Work)”, which was included on his debut album Supermodel of the World (1993). In 1996, RuPaul landed a television show on VH1. The RuPaul Show , he taped over 100 episodes with his co-host Michelle Visage. Since 2009, he has produced and hosted the competition series RuPaul’s Drag Race , for which he received six Primetime Emmy Awards, in 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019. RuPaul is considered the most commercially successful drag queen in the United States. States In 2017, he was included in Time 100’s annual list of the world’s most influential people. As an actor, RuPaul appeared in films such as Queens and Kings (1995) and But I’m a Cheerleader (1999), and in the Netflix original programming Girlboss (2017) and Grace and Frankie (2019). In 2020 he starred in the Netflix series AJ and the Queen .
